result.execSummary:
The defendant Keilah N. MELLON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud Against Financial Institution as repeater (Value does not Exceed $500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).
  • Fraud Against Financial Institution as repeater (Value does not Exceed $500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).
  • Fraud Against Financial Institution as repeater (Value does not Exceed $500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

$1,135.75 to United One Credit Union; Attention:  Shannon Schad, at 1117 S. 10th Street, Manitowoc, WI.

Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 1 only, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

(Re: case no: 14 CM 203)

Count 1 - PTC Fraud Against Financial Institution as repeater - No contest plea. 
Count 2 - PTC Fraud Against Financial Institution as repeater - No contest plea. 
Count 3 - PTC Fraud Against Financial Institution as repeater - No contest plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 4 through 8.   Motion granted.   Sentencing hearing is set for 11-24-15 at 8:30 a.m.   
Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

$250.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice ot Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond.

Defendant in custody.  
Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 02-24-15 at 11:00 a.m.   Counsel argue modification of bail.  Court reduces bail to $250.00 cash with the additional condition that defendant have a daily reporting to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department by 6:00 p.m.  
Minutes.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Modification.
RE:  United One Credit Union, on 12-11-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of fraud on financial institution as repeater and theft by fraud as repeater.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-02-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with Luke Yanda, Jessica Peterson, Kayla Curtis, Lacey Komanekin and with any United One Credit Untion Branches in Manitowoc County.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. 
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
